Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed


The 4 Decepticon researchers waited
and waited
and waited for their supposed rescuers to arrive and save their scratched 
and mangled armor from the scorching sun of the African plains.

But Sand Storm was growing restless, " Why the Pit haven't they come 
already? My paint jobs baking in this heat!" he complained as he squatted 
down in Blue Flame's shadow to try and get out of the sun.

Although Diesel Runner squinted out into the distance, her hands on her 
hips. " Maybe they're not coming."

Sand Storm looked up at her with a flabbergasted expression from watching a 
lady bug crawl over his foot. " You can't be serious. They HAVE to!" he 
whimpered.
But Blue Flame only shrugged as he looked down at the little dune buggy. 
Kind of feeling sorry for the little guy.
He didn't want to be stranded here any more then Sand Storm did. But there 
was nothing they could do about it. They were stuck here.
Although...by the way Dark Cloud acted all calm and collected, it didn't 
seem to make any difference to HIM.
Blue Flame sighed as he let his shoulder-plates sag as the heat even began 
to bother him too.
They were getting low on energy again...but at that thought he glanced over 
at their fearless leader.
D.R. seemed to be going as strong as ever, even though she hadn't energized 
with the rest of them before they'd dealt with that core.
How did she do it?

"Well, if they're not here in fifteen minuets, who ever they are...we're 
going to go and see if we can find a place to spend the night." the fembot 
announced before turning to her crew. " I'm not going to wait forever for 
anyone."
And frankly, this heat was getting to her too.

<DIV></DIV>>From the hillside she smiled. Hearing his voice again did bring joy to her. 
<DIV></DIV>>as well as an ache.. an ache to be at the base, to be in hi arms. But, the 
<DIV></DIV>>reality was, she had a duty to do. 
<DIV></DIV>> 
<DIV></DIV>>"I very much missed you," she purred. Her voice was rather soft. "I awaited 
<DIV></DIV>>for you to be repaired. Perceptor stated your damage was great & that it would 
<DIV></DIV>>take some time to repair the damaged areas. Then I was called away." 
<DIV></DIV>> 
<DIV></DIV>>She pondered a moment, as a sweet yet sly smile came upon her face, "I was 
<DIV></DIV>>never bored," she paused, "Just lonely," she hated the idea of spilling her 
<DIV></DIV>>emotions & feeling them, but.. she let them this time. How she ached for him. 
<DIV></DIV>> 
<DIV></DIV>>Then turning a little serious. "I have Blackstorm. We are on a rendezvous 
<DIV></DIV>>with some newly arrived Decepticons. We shall bring them back soon enough."
